text:
122 Cypress Ave. (right, on which factory faces), at the S.E. corner of East 134th Street, showing the factory of the Standard Musical String Manufacturing Corporation. The view is across Southern Boulevard, on which tracks are visible in the foreground.

April 12, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
133-151 Southern Boulevard, west side, from East 134th to East 135th Streets, showing three integral units of the apartment house Retorno. The unit on the right actually faces on Cypress Ave.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; a fuller view at a later date. On the extreme right is also visible Public School No. 29, at the N.W. corner of Cypress Ave. and East 135th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a still later date, showing the house under demolition. The demolition is being carried out to make way for the construction of the approach to the Triborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
133-151 Southern Boulevard, west side, from East 134th to East 135th Streets, showing three integral units of the apartment house Retorno. The unit on the right actually faces on Cypress Ave.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; a fuller view at a later date. On the extreme right is also visible Public School No. 29, at the N.W. corner of Cypress Ave. and East 135th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a still later date, showing the house under demolition. The demolition is being carried out to make way for the construction of the approach to the Triborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
133-151 Southern Boulevard, west side, from East 134th to East 135th Streets, showing three integral units of the apartment house Retorno. The unit on the right actually faces on Cypress Ave.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; a fuller view at a later date. On the extreme right is also visible Public School No. 29, at the N.W. corner of Cypress Ave. and East 135th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a still later date, showing the house under demolition. The demolition is being carried out to make way for the construction of the approach to the Triborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Southern Boulevard (running from left to right background), north from East 135th Street. The 6-story apartment house, in the center of the view, faces on East 135th Street, at the N.E. corner of Cypress Ave., bearing No. 200 on the latter. Also shown (left) is Cypress Ave., north from East 135th Street. The vantage point is the S.E. corner of Cypress Ave. and East 134th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A limited view of the same, excluding the 6-story house facing on East 135th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Southern Boulevard (running from left to right background), north from East 135th Street. The 6-story apartment house, in the center of the view, faces on East 135th Street, at the N.E. corner of Cypress Ave., bearing No. 200 on the latter. Also shown (left) is Cypress Ave., north from East 135th Street. The vantage point is the S.E. corner of Cypress Ave. and East 134th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A limited view of the same, excluding the 6-story house facing on East 135th Street.

P. L. Sperr.

Cypress Ave., west side, north from East 134th to East 136th Streets, showing the cleared area from East 134th to 135th Streets, created as a result of the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there to make way for the erection of an approach to the Triborough Bridge. Also shown is Public School No. 29, occupying the block from East 135th to 136th Streets and the Krakauer Piano factory at the N.W. corner of East 136th Street. The buildings on the left are on the north side of East 135th Street and bear Nos. 635 to 621.

P.L. Sperr.

July 29, 1937.
